application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

affiliation.orgName: Interdepartmental Bioinformatics Group Max Planck Institutes Tübingen
Interdepartmental Bioinformatics Group Max Planck Institutes Tübingen

abstract.p: In this article, we propose fast subtree kernels on graphs. On graphs with n nodes and m edges and maximum degree d, these kernels comparing subtrees of height h can be computed in O(mh), whereas the classic subtree kernel by Ramon & Gärtner scales as O(n 2 4 d h). Key to this efficiency is the observation that the Weisfeiler-Lehman test of isomorphism from graph theory elegantly computes a subtree kernel as a byproduct. Our fast subtree kernels can deal with labeled graphs, scale up easily to large graphs and outperform state-of-the-art graph kernels on several classification benchmark datasets in terms of accuracy and runtime.
